required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Define Safety and Effectiveness of Dolutegravir (DTG) Use in Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) Positive Pregnant Women
clinical_study.official_title: DOLOMITE NEAT ID Network Study: A Prospective, Multi-site Observational Study to Define the Safety and Effectiveness of Dolutegravir Use in HIV Positive Pregnant Women

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and effectiveness of DTG use in HIV positive pregnant women. This is a 3-year multi-site prospective observational study. Approximately, 250 HIV positive pregnant women from potential European AIDS Treatment Network (NEAT ID) sites across Europe will be enrolled. The enrollment period will be over 2 years with a follow-up period of 1 year for outcomes. The data collected will be that obtained during routine standard of care assessments; and the subjects will not undergo any interventional study procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of female subjects with spontaneous abortion
primary_outcome.description: Spontaneous abortion is defined as death of a fetus or expulsion of the products of conception before 22 weeks gestation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of female subjects with induced abortion
primary_outcome.description: Induced abortion is defined as voluntary termination of pregnancy before 22 weeks gestation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of female subjects giving still births
primary_outcome.description: Still birth is defined as the death of a fetus occurring at 22 weeks of gestation or more, or for situations in which the gestational age is unavailable, a fetus weighing at least 500 grams.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of female subjects with multiple births
primary_outcome.description: Number of female subjects giving multiple births will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of female subjects with type of deliveries
primary_outcome.description: The different type of deliveries will be summarized.
The maternal viral load at the time of delivery will be summarized.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of infants with birth defects
primary_outcome.description: Birth defects will be classified according to World Health Organization's International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision.
Number of females with birth collected data for gestational age as a measure of birth defects will be reported.
Number of females with birth collected data for birth weight as a measure of birth defects will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of female subjects giving premature births
primary_outcome.description: Premature birth is defined as birth of live infant at <32 weeks gestation

primary_outcome.measure: Number of female subjects giving live births
primary_outcome.description: Number of female subjects giving live births will be reported.
Low birth weight is defined as birth weight of <2500 grams.

primary_outcome.measure: Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, Respiration (APGAR) score in infants
primary_outcome.description: APGAR score in infants as a measure of birth defects will be calculated.
Infant's HIV status as a measure of birth defects will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of female subjects with drug related Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of females with all drug related Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events will be reported. These will be categorized by trimester of initiation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of DTG discontinuation in pregnant women
secondary_outcome.description: Number of pregnant females with discontinuation of DTG will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who discontinued DTG
secondary_outcome.description: Reasons for DTG discontinuation will be summarized. Number of participants who discontinued DTG will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with VL at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: VL at discontinuation will be summarized to assess suppression. Number of participants with VL at discontinuation will be reported.

arm_group.description: Data from approximately 250 HIV positive pregnant women with exposure to DTG from potential investigational sites across Europe will be included.

intervention.description: Subjects with DTG exposure during any trimester will be included

study_pop.textblock: Approximately, 250 HIV positive pregnant women having exposure to DTG from potential NEAT ID investigational sites across Europe will be enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV positive pregnant women aged 18 years and over on DTG
- With no maternal or birth outcomes yet
- Subjects are able and willing to provide written informed consent and comply with any safety reporting requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
-

overall_contact.last_name: US GSK Clinical Trials Call Center

overall_contact_backup.last_name: EU GSK Clinical Trials Call Center

contact.last_name: US GSK Clinical Trials Call Center

contact_backup.last_name: EU GSK Clinical Trials Call Centre

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD for this study will be made available via the Clinical Study Data Request Site
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: IPD will be made available within 6 months of publishing the results of the primary endpoints of the study
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access is provided after a research proposal is submitted and has received approval from the Independent Review Panel and after a Data Sharing Agreement is in place. Access is provided for an initial period of 12 months but an extension can be granted, when justified, for up to another 12 months.
